title.@value: Neonatal hyperbilirubinaemia due to swallowed maternal blood

definition.@value: A condition characterised as an increased level of bilirubin above 85 umol/l (5 mg/dL) which manifests as yellowing of the eyes, skin, and other tissues of a newborn due consumption by the newborn of blood from the mother.

label.@value: Neonatal hyperbilirubinaemia due to swallowed maternal blood
